[{'created': '2019-04-25 09:50:58.000000000', 'message': 'Use upper constraints from opendev.org

oslo.cache uses a simple curl command in its tox_install.sh
to fetch the upper-constraints, and curl does not follow redirects
that are now in place due to move to opendev.org.

This breaks running tox-based tests w/o overriding the
UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE which upstream CI does,
for example running tox locally.

Change-Id: Ifcb555c8f4ccb813b48c613c79dceb4bf23318eb
(cherry picked from commit 6eceb160eaaebbc6ea04768f62876738aa61c2d1)
'}]
commit_message:
Use upper constraints from opendev.org

oslo.cache uses a simple curl command in its tox_install.sh
to fetch the upper-constraints, and curl does not follow redirects
that are now in place due to move to opendev.org.

This breaks running tox-based tests w/o overriding the
UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE which upstream CI does,
for example running tox locally.

Change-Id: Ifcb555c8f4ccb813b48c613c79dceb4bf23318eb
(cherry picked from commit 6eceb160eaaebbc6ea04768f62876738aa61c2d1)

rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8788e5239a785f249ba1235551e7d799789a82f1

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints

The 'install_command' section was being overridden in 'tox.ini', meaning
we were never using the constraints 'lower-constraints.txt'. Fix this
and update the few requirements necessary.

- oslo.db so we get Ifb2c59c2cfbd615b04570b31fcfe868f4ffea3c6 which is
  necessary for Python 3.7 support
- python-glanceclient so we get the HTTP error messages expected in unit
  tests since I1608f82eeaa6ff4c5ac55f57989bb1cfe17dbdc7. This also
  necessitates updating keystoneauth1.
- The minimum of Sphinx is bumped to 1.7.0 to avoid the need to
  blacklist multiple 1.6.x versions

In addition, these minimums are reflected in test-requirements.txt and
requirements.txt. This is expected by the 'requirements-check' job in
the gate.

Change-Id: Ib96387c1e295a2c92debf761893708d110e544c5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.

Change-Id: I31244b2fc8759820398b6fe17d6469c56fcb44b1

[{'created': '2018-06-07 09:43:49.000000000', 'message': 'Updating time for functional tests

Currenlty, some gates is being failed with logs like this

"""
b'Response: {"description": "Provided object does not match schema
\'Secret\': \'expiration\' is before current time.
Invalid property: \'expiration\'", "title": "Bad Request", "code": 400}'

commit_message:
Updating time for functional tests

Currenlty, some gates is being failed with logs like this

"""
b'Response: {"description": "Provided object does not match schema
\'Secret\': \'expiration\' is before current time.
Invalid property: \'expiration\'", "title": "Bad Request", "code": 400}'
"""

So it is necessary to update the time to create secrets successfully.

Change-Id: I4f2d3817d9a2380919d16e76ef5dcba3ec62e5a1
(cherry picked from commit f27c0f727a8ee48591996178efccbd235d651574)

commit_message:
Add service-rabbitmq role

This role can be used by other roles to register RabbitMQ resources.
Currently support is provided for creating virtual hosts and users.

Change-Id: Ie1774a10b4d629508584af679b8aa9e372847804
Partially Implements: blueprint support-nova-cells
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/684742

commit_message:
Mark Virtuozzo Driver Unsupported

The Virtuozzo driver CI has not reported success in months
and the maintainers have not responded to any of the notes that
have been sent out.

As a result, we need to mark the drivers unsupported
for the T release.

Change-Id: Ic9c239baff19ec9cfbc1a114cdd9a899a34bedd6
(cherry picked from commit cf01d7eaf370485fe3fb834a3bcad13b0773b6e1)

commit_message:
Add retry to LVM deactivation

We are seeing occassional failures to deactivate logical volumes in
tempest runs. We retry on the wait for the state change, but we if that
doesn't succeed we just give up.

This adds a retry to the whole deactivation process to see if requesting
again has better luck deactivating the volume.

Change-Id: I1f9546c39ea05abe524e6f38395754d331b201cd
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Its confusing whether acl_only is boolean or other datatype.

Assuming its boolean, CLI to list secrets fails with:

$ barbican secret list --acl_only
usage: barbican secret list [-h]
                            [-f {csv,html,json,json,table,value,yaml,yaml}]
                            [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent]
                            [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}]
                            [--limit LIMIT] [--offset OFFSET] [--name NAME]
                            [--algorithm ALGORITHM] [--bit-length BIT_LENGTH]
                            [--mode MODE] [--acl_only ACL_ONLY]
barbican secret list: error: argument --acl_only: expected one argument

whereas, it works if acl_only is set to True or False:

$ barbican secret list --acl_only False
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+------+---------------------------+--------+-------------------------------------------+-----------+------------+-------------+------+------------+
| Secret href                                                           | Name | Created                   | Status | Content types                             | Algorithm | Bit length | Secret type | Mode | Expiration |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+------+---------------------------+--------+-------------------------------------------+-----------+------------+-------------+------+------------+
| http://10.0.2.15:9311/v1/secrets/57c0a9db-061a-4af4-a26f-fdc0f4e56011 | None | 2015-11-23 23:42:34+00:00 | ACTIVE | {u'default': u'application/octet-stream'} | aes       |        256 | opaque      | cbc  | None       |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+------+---------------------------+--------+-------------------------------------------+-----------+------------+-------------+------+------------+


I think, acl_only should be boolean and instead of setting it to None in "barbicanclient/barbican_cli/secrets.py", mark it as boolean with action='store_true', default=False

Cheers
Priti'}, {'account_id': 15274, 'date': '2015-11-24 17:07:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hey Priti.

I actually already tried that. The server expects a string which is why I set acl_only as a string. If I set acl_only as a boolean value then it doesn't work properly. I can change the way the server implements it to accept the argument as a boolean instead of a string if enough people feel the same way. Initially I thought it should be a boolean as well."}, {'account_id': 10281, 'date': '2015-11-24 18:20:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

Thanks Chris,

I vote for boolean as ideally it should only accept True or False but since its a string type, accepts any garbage value and marks that as False:

$ barbican secret list --acl_only Garbage
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+------+---------------------------+--------+-------------------------------------------+-----------+------------+-------------+------+------------+
| Secret href                                                           | Name | Created                   | Status | Content types                             | Algorithm | Bit length | Secret type | Mode | Expiration |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+------+---------------------------+--------+-------------------------------------------+-----------+------------+-------------+------+------------+
| http://10.0.2.15:9311/v1/secrets/57c0a9db-061a-4af4-a26f-fdc0f4e56011 | None | 2015-11-23 23:42:34+00:00 | ACTIVE | {u'default': u'application/octet-stream'} | aes       |        256 | opaque      | cbc  | None       |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+------+---------------------------+--------+-------------------------------------------+-----------+------------+-------------+------+------------+

$ barbican secret list --acl_only False
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+------+---------------------------+--------+-------------------------------------------+-----------+------------+-------------+------+------------+
| Secret href                                                           | Name | Created                   | Status | Content types                             | Algorithm | Bit length | Secret type | Mode | Expiration |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+------+---------------------------+--------+-------------------------------------------+-----------+------------+-------------+------+------------+
| http://10.0.2.15:9311/v1/secrets/57c0a9db-061a-4af4-a26f-fdc0f4e56011 | None | 2015-11-23 23:42:34+00:00 | ACTIVE | {u'default': u'application/octet-stream'} | aes       |        256 | opaque      | cbc  | None       |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+------+---------------------------+--------+-------------------------------------------+-----------+------------+-------------+------+------------+

$ barbican secret list --acl_only True
<Empty List>"}, {'account_id': 10281, 'date': '2015-11-24 18:21:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 17579, 'date': '2015-11-24 19:42:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

(1 comment)

What about this:
Only do the action if --acl_only is set in the command line.
When putting the parameters into the URL, set &acl_only=True or acl_only=true (I forgot which one).'}, {'account_id': 15274, 'date': '2015-11-24 20:03:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 15274, 'date': '2015-11-24 20:04:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Thanks to elvin and Priti's comments I figured out how to add the value as a Boolean value. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 16046, 'date': '2015-11-24 20:36:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Add acl filter to secrets

Adds the acl_only filter to return secrets that contain the user
on the acl. Also adds a test to make sure feature is working.

Change-Id: I31b38babb16680268fc380bc81cb91bb54a98197

commit_message:
podman_image_facts: fix listing all images

The \n is problematic because the last line is empty. Let's just remove
it and use split().

Change-Id: Ib967c2fec8ef976200e9f7221649f2be02a7b443

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id299ff47ba306e453ab9c08160ad98ff47530ab7

(3 comments)

This does not seem to solve the issue noted in the linked bug: "HTTP errors from secrets.payload API are not caught and wrapped with barbicanclient exceptions". It seems that none of the methods called in the modified get() method actually throw a barbicanclient.exceptions.HTTP* exception. Furthermore, the HTTPServerError and HTTPClientError exceptions are not even implemented in barbicanclient/exceptions.py.'}, {'account_id': 24924, 'date': '2017-03-07 03:54:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-07 04:31:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

Hi Dave McCowan,

I think the test was skipped on purpose and needs to be fixed. That is why it was skipped. Please confirm.'}, {'account_id': 11561, 'date': '2017-03-17 13:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Kiran, Thanks for looking at this!

https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-barbicanclient/+bug/1425667 needs to be fixed, then this test case should updated to check for both passing and failing cases.

When creating an order with name==None, a 4xx should be returned immediately.  Now, it creates the order, but fails in processing.

There are broken test cases here, and in python-barbicanclient that both can be updated after this is fixed.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 03:55:32.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

Abandoned due to lack of activity.  Please Restore this patch if it's still needed."}]

messages:
[{'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-10-13 22:10:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-10-13 22:16:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Both of the interactive tests really need to send a few commands in via stdin to verify stuff is working, but it's late Friday afternoon and I wanted to get some feedback on the overall approach before diving in to that.

This in theory is backward-compatible, with the exception of not raising an exception that gets caught higher up in App.run_subcommand()."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-10-13 23:05:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Thanks Doug.  I do want to do the set command thing, but wanted to think it through for more general settings before rolling it out.  Things like being able to switch cloud configs between commands in an input file for an OSC-centric example.  I will re-work it to remove the options...'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-10-14 15:09:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-10-18 00:08:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-10-18 00:14:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Doug, https://review.openstack.org/512903 is what the OSC (osc-lib actually) side of this looks like.  I have to override interact() completely to change the constructor args for InteractiveApp, so you can change it but it's not completely usable.  Since I had to do that much I had it catch the TypeError in case an older cliff or another InteractiveApp class doesn't know errexit.

I'm all ears on a cleaner way to do this, it feels a bit hacky to me still."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-10-18 02:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-10-18 12:42:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Doug, https://review.openstack.org/512903 is what the OSC (osc-lib
 > actually) side of this looks like.  I have to override interact()
 > completely to change the constructor args for InteractiveApp, so
 > you can change it but it's not completely usable.  Since I had to
 > do that much I had it catch the TypeError in case an older cliff or
 > another InteractiveApp class doesn't know errexit.
 > 
 > I'm all ears on a cleaner way to do this, it feels a bit hacky to
 > me still.

I haven't looked deeply into this code in a while, but my first thought is to provide some way to override that interactive class. Maybe as a constructor argument to the main App class?

OTOH, I don't really have an issue with building the short-cut stuff into the base implementation. It seems widely usable."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-05-04 20:32:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-05-06 20:33:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-05-11 03:38:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-08-05 22:05:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

There's a TODO here but that can be addressed later"}]

commit_message:
Add an errexit attribute to InteractiveApp to exit on command errors

This only affects interactive mode.

The desire is to enable a behaviour similar to the shell's set +errexit.
To do this required changing function returns in a number of places in
order to propogate the exit code back up to the app.

Change-Id: I1f2606cb43c8064e465e87d6801ed8d169daa26a

commit_message:
Revert "Set binding profile directly from OVNTrunkDriver"

During recent days we many observed failures of 
neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_trunk.TrunkTest.test_trunk_subport_lifecycle test. 
It started to fail on a different asserts. 
Lets revert this patch, as it is a regression, and work further on this issue.

This reverts commit 41f6d622abc65ca4c10b08f8c022915df2809255.

Related-Bug: #1834637
Related-Bug: #1845479

Change-Id: I63acf0c809aa158aeba1c79c7c9083966ffd58a3

messages:
[{'account_id': 22962, 'date': '2016-07-27 20:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2016-07-27 20:14:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Barbican client container command error check

Barbican client command to create container does not check if secret ref
provided is not as per the convention "name=secretRef". Added checks for
secret ref options. Updated functional test cases. Updated fix using
argparse 'type' argument.

Change-Id: Ic2fe4807ef6b4e786b2afae11e63c79a9fa42252
Closes-Bug: #1606790

commit_message:
conf: Remove deprecated 'project_id_regex' opt

The 'project_id_regex' opt is used as a workaround for the test
like 'fake' 'openstack' etc, it's deprecated since 13.0.0
so time to remove it.

Co-Authored-By: jichenjc <jichenjc@cn.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I3eac9ac0a2a698a3c72b4e646cdcaf293ec4b057

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/446762
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I227774a3be02080d57ef5c6528af69a5723651cf

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-12 14:01:26.000000000', 'message': 'Support time range to query dimension names/values

At present, dimensions are not scoped by time window, which makes
dimension related queries to large databases timeout because it searches
all of time instead of a time window specified on the grafana app.

This commit adds tempest tests to accompany the changes to the API
server.

Change-Id: Ibc5378deea51a18ed7dac857b26d770950b17620
Story: 2006204
Task: 35805
'}, {'created': '2019-07-12 14:05:23.000000000', 'message': 'Support time range to query dimension names/values

At present, dimensions are not scoped by time window, which makes
dimension related queries to large databases timeout because it searches
all of time instead of a time window specified on the grafana app.

This commit adds tempest tests to accompany the changes to the API
server.

commit_message:
Support time range to query dimension names/values

At present, dimensions are not scoped by time window, which makes
dimension related queries to large databases timeout because it searches
all of time instead of a time window specified on the grafana app.

This commit adds tempest tests to accompany the changes to the API
server and as such, depends on it.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670318/
Change-Id: Ibc5378deea51a18ed7dac857b26d770950b17620
Story: 2006204
Task: 35805

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-10-20 03:30:22.000000000', 'message': "Add --file flag for secrets

This patch adds a --file (-F) flag to both 'secret store' and 'secret
get' commands to work around a cliff formatter limitation when dealing
with binary data.  This flag can be used to store a payload directly
from a file so that a user doesn't have to do any base64 juggling of
their data.

The flag can also be used to save a payload directly to a file so we can
avoid UTF-8 and ASCII encoding errors thrown by the cliff formatters
that expect text data.

Change-Id: I2b1447534719c5796d185051198dc35d0b2c60f0
"}, {'created': '2016-10-20 17:32:20.000000000', 'message': "Add --file flag for secrets

their data.

The flag can also be used to save a payload directly to a file so we can
avoid UTF-8 and ASCII encoding errors thrown by the cliff formatters
that expect text data.

Change-Id: I2b1447534719c5796d185051198dc35d0b2c60f0

commit_message:
Add --file flag for secrets

This patch adds a --file (-F) flag to both 'secret store' and 'secret
get' commands to work around a cliff formatter limitation when dealing
with binary data.  This flag can be used to store a payload directly
from a file so that a user doesn't have to do any base64 juggling of
their data.

The flag can also be used to save a payload directly to a file so we can
avoid UTF-8 and ASCII encoding errors thrown by the cliff formatters
that expect text data.

Change-Id: I2b1447534719c5796d185051198dc35d0b2c60f0

commit_message:
Add 'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv

Running py2* post py3* tests results in error.
Add 'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv to
resolve this.

Change-Id: If84293c8c0dba9fb967dea01073a3cd4f7feb0f0
Closes-Bug: #1565928

messages:
[{'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-09-20 15:49:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-09-20 16:08:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM - If this helps get things through the gate I am happy. Use FN however it works best.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-09-20 16:25:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

the real motivation is to eventually be able to make a job that use nested virt voting at some point.

as long as we are using a lable that can only be provided by one cloud, regardless of how stable it is i am not comfortable make a job voting so this will help with that goal. i intend to start using this for netorking-ovs-dpdk and os-vif to test ovs-dpdk integration with openstack and eventually expand it to other testing in nova.

i plan to be concerrvitve and graduate the jobs nova job with core consent form perordic+experimental to non-voting check then to voting in check over the course of the Ussuri cycle.

for os-vif and networking-ovs-dpdk i plan to be more agressive and go to non voting check the voting check more quickly for ovs-dpdk testing since i have core rights and can backout the job if need.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-09-30 06:03:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

I feel like overall we've tried to keep the idea that nodepool is a "pool" and not tried to split things up into smaller and smaller categories, such that jobs evolve to become specific enough to only run in essentially limited conditions.  

Perhaps, though, nested kvm is now a mature enough idea that this is less of a concern, and we have a broad enough coverage that should one provider disappear we're not left with jobs that have no home.

I'd go with the group consensus, but would like to see PTL weigh in as it is a bit of a change in policy...'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-10-01 20:07:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Nested virt with KVM as deployed on our clouds is probably not quite as reliable as we'd like it to be. That said we now seem to have cloud operator involvement at a level that allows us to try this and really shake out the remaining issues with nested virt.

It would be nice to have the cloud providers ack this change before we merge it though just to be sure we have their buy in first.

I think the goal here would be to provide this more universally through the improvements to the software that can be made by actively using it."}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-10-01 20:10:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

LGTM - happy to support it'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-10-01 20:11:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2019-10-02 15:31:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

bring it! limestone's bare-metal testing jobs live or die by nested virt, so we are very motivated to keep it working."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-10-02 17:30:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-20 15:49:45.000000000', 'message': 'add common nested-virt lables

This change adds two new lables nested-virt-ubuntu-bionic
and nested-virt-centos-7 to fort nebula, limestone adn vexxhost.
currently jobs that require nested virt to function mus use provider
specific lables to ensure the job can execute correctly.
The addtion of common nested virt lables will allow more redundency
ensuring that if a specific provider is offline the node requests can
be fullfiled by the remaining providers. These new lables are identical
to the existing centos-7 and ubuntu-bionic lables. it is intended that
most jobs should continute to use the non nested virt lables and only
new jobs that require nested virt will use the new lables.

Change-Id: I3795fee1530045363e3f629f0793cbe6e95c23ca
'}]
commit_message:
add common nested-virt lables

This change adds two new lables nested-virt-ubuntu-bionic
and nested-virt-centos-7 to fort nebula, limestone adn vexxhost.
currently jobs that require nested virt to function mus use provider
specific lables to ensure the job can execute correctly.
The addtion of common nested virt lables will allow more redundency
ensuring that if a specific provider is offline the node requests can
be fullfiled by the remaining providers. These new lables are identical
to the existing centos-7 and ubuntu-bionic lables. it is intended that
most jobs should continute to use the non nested virt lables and only
new jobs that require nested virt will use the new lables.

Change-Id: I3795fee1530045363e3f629f0793cbe6e95c23ca

commit_message:
Add support for configuring permitted_ethertypes on OVS agent

Neutron recently added support for configuring non-IP ethernet types to
be allowed through firewalls through SECURITYGROUP/permitted_ethertypes.
This adds support for configuring this feature on the ML2/OVS agent.
See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668224 for related neutron change.

Conflicts:
  spec/classes/neutron_agents_ml2_ovs_spec.rb

Related-Bug: #1832758
Change-Id: I9ed539745a705936d9a5110a9cfb05c2f28b0bbb
(cherry picked from commit def07975c604ecc3215fa17dc10fc0ac8fa40545)

commit_message:
Fix incorrect usages of fake moref in VMware tests

In some cases fake ManagedObjectReference object are incorrectly
instantiated so that values of 'name' and 'value' fields are swapped or
one is put in the field meant for the other.

Change-Id: Ia735524708df68ac25807673afc3a9ee48830afd

commit_message:
[Queens] Add workflow to do cellv2 host discovery

When the compute bootstrap node gets blacklisted or deployment is
run with skip-deploy-identifier the discovery job in step_5
won't run and requires a manual post deploy/scale step.

This introduce a workflow to run the discovery via an ansible
playbook.

Change-Id: I54d42df162a6744806301d97bca5d94e5f380a2b
Related-Bug: #1831711

subject: Add reno about nova-api eventlet monkey-patching and rabbitmq
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 8770, 'name': 'Ken Giusti', 'email': 'kgiusti@gmail.com', 'username': 'kgiusti'}, {'_account_id': 9555, 'name': 'Matthew Booth', 'email': 'mbooth@redhat.com', 'username': 'MatthewBooth'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23561, 'name': 'iain MacDonnell', 'email': 'iain.macdonnell@oracle.com', 'username': 'imacdonn'}, {'_account_id': 26458, 'name': 'Brin Zhang', 'email': 'zhangbailin@inspur.com', 'username': 'zhangbailin'}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-05-29 21:34:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-05-29 21:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-05-29 21:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2019-05-29 22:19:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks for doing this. It'll be good if we can at least nail down the workarounds.

I've been investigating the failure to reestablish the connection(s) with threads>1 a bit more. It turns out that the oslo.messaging driver for rabbitmq actually opens *two* connections to service RPC - the first is used to listen for replies, and the second to send requests. My observation is that the connection used to send requests gets a "connection reset by peer", and opens a new connection, through which the request does actually get sent. The problem us that the connection used to listen for replies is still dead, so the reply does not get consumed from the AMQP queue. I don't know how threading works in enough detail, but I'm guessing that the connection used to listen for replies could be running in a different thread, and that thread is not waking up.

I'd been planning on reverting to running nova-api as a standalone daemon (for Stein deployments that are pending), because I still don't have warm fuzzies about this, even with threads=1. Are we really sure that that will consistently reestablish the connections and work reliably?'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-05-29 23:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Thanks for doing this. It'll be good if we can at least nail down
 > the workarounds.

++

 > I've been investigating the failure to reestablish the
 > connection(s) with threads>1 a bit more. It turns out that the
 > oslo.messaging driver for rabbitmq actually opens *two* connections
 > to service RPC - the first is used to listen for replies, and the
 > second to send requests. My observation is that the connection used
 > to send requests gets a "connection reset by peer", and opens a new
 > connection, through which the request does actually get sent. The
 > problem us that the connection used to listen for replies is still
 > dead, so the reply does not get consumed from the AMQP queue. I
 > don't know how threading works in enough detail, but I'm guessing
 > that the connection used to listen for replies could be running in
 > a different thread, and that thread is not waking up.

Oh, nice find. I don't know enough detail about threading either, but your guess sounds like what could be happening. Seems like it would depend on how wsgi app behavior works when threads > 1 -- when a new request comes in, the app resumes from a paused state, but does it wake up all threads or only the one the new request came in on? If it's the latter, then each thread would lazily wake up when a new request hits it? I wonder if there's any wsgi app config related to this.

 > I'd been planning on reverting to running nova-api as a standalone
 > daemon (for Stein deployments that are pending), because I still
 > don't have warm fuzzies about this, even with threads=1. Are we
 > really sure that that will consistently reestablish the connections
 > and work reliably?

You mean, plan to run nova-api using the eventlet wsgi server? True that would be guaranteed to work. We are not 100% sure that threads=1 given a comment sean-k-mooney had made which said, paraphrasing, that if the main thread is one thread and the wsgi app is an additional one thread, then there are two threads and thus a 50% chance that the thread for the send and reply are the same one. But, I'm thinking this depends on how the wsgi resume works? If the wsgi app can only serve requests on its one thread and that one wakes up when a new request comes in while the app is idle, then we would be guaranteed to reconnect and have requests work properly upon a resume. This also seems likely considering Vexxhost is running Stein with eventlet monkey-patching enabled and threads=1 and has not experienced any issues with requests failing. And you'd think they would have seen it by now if there were a 50% chance of the send/reply threads being different.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-05-30 01:42:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

there are a few other uwsgi option that are worth exploring

i think setting the single-interpreter option may help is some cases.
e.g. threads>1
https://uwsgi-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Options.html#single-interpreter

also setting die on idel to false may prevent the sleep behavior entrily.
https://uwsgi-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Options.html#die-on-idle
in a similar vain using cheap mode
https://uwsgi-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Options.html#cheap
may similarly prevent the main api form being suspened.

finally you could change the min worker lifetime form 60 seconds to a larger value to similarly contol the minium interval before it could be suspended.
https://uwsgi-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Options.html#min-worker-lifetime

i have not however had time to test any of the above so we shoudl not put them in the release note but i think there are ohter mitgaton via the config that we could explore in addtion to the other avenues we are looking at.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-05-30 02:36:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

> (2 comments)

 > there are a few other uwsgi option that are worth exploring

Ack and agreed can't put them in the reno until we test them."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-05-30 09:31:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-05-30 14:21:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/662095/3 : SUCCESS in 2h 21m 09s'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2019-05-31 17:14:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> there are a few other uwsgi option that are worth exploring
 
The uWSGI docs are a bit sparse, but I don't think that any of the options below are pertinent. I did try them anyway, but none helped.


 > i think setting the single-interpreter option may help is some
 > cases.
 > e.g. threads>1
 > https://uwsgi-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Options.html#single-interpreter
 
I can reproduce the problem with a single process (with 8 threads). I'm guessing there's already only one interpreter in that case.


 > also setting die on idel to false may prevent the sleep behavior
 > entrily.
 > https://uwsgi-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Options.html#die-on-idle
 > in a similar vain using cheap mode
 > https://uwsgi-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Options.html#cheap
 > may similarly prevent the main api form being suspened.
 
I believe that these two options pertain to dynamically spawned vassals.


 > finally you could change the min worker lifetime form 60 seconds to
 > a larger value to similarly contol the minium interval before it
 > could be suspended.
 > https://uwsgi-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Options.html#min-worker-lifetime
 
I don't think that that has anything to do with suspending threads - rather when workers get reloaded.

I was actually able to make the problem go away by setting *max*-worker-lifetime to 30 seconds. This causes workers to get whacked/replaced before their connections can time out. I don't think it's a good solution, though, as those workers would get whacked even if they are active and busy, which would (presumably) incur a performance hit in a busy environment."}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-06-03 15:06:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-20 04:38:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix stable gate

This is a combination of 2 commits.

---

py2/3: Stop using stdlib's putrequest(); it only does ASCII

Note that this only affects the functest client.

See also: https://bugs.python.org/issue36274 and
https://bugs.python.org/issue38216

This was previously done just for py3 compatibility, but following
https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/bb8071a our stable gates are
all broken -- apparently, they're running a 2.7 pre-release?

(cherry picked from commit c0ae48ba9aafb0b91869ea3bae8da07a32088777)
(cherry picked from commit 2b4d58952cae8b174fb60529d5284c1d328e9287)

---

bufferedhttp: ensure query params are properly quoted

Recent versions of py27 [1] have begun raising InvalidURL if you try to
include non-ASCII characters in the request path. This was observed
recently in the periodic checks of stable/ocata and stable/pike. In
particular, we would spin up some in-process servers in
test.unit.proxy.test_server.TestSocketObjectVersions and do a container
listing with a prefix param that included raw (unquoted) UTF-8. This
query string would pass unmolested through the proxy, tripping the
InvalidURL error when bufferedhttp called putrequest.

More recent versions of Swift would not exhibit this particular failure,
as the listing_formats middleware would force a decoding/re-encoding of
the query string for account and container requests. However, object
requests with errant query strings would likely be able to trip the same
error.

Swift on py3 should not exhibit this behavior, as we so
thoroughly re-write the request line to avoid hitting
https://bugs.python.org/issue33973.

Now, always parse and re-encode the query string in bufferedhttp. This
prevents any errors on object requests and cleans up any callers that
might use bufferedhttp directly.

[1] Anything after https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/bb8071a;
    see https://bugs.python.org/issue30458

Closes-Bug: 1843816
Related-Change: Id3ce37aa0402e2d8dd5784ce329d7cb4fbaf700d
Related-Change: Ie648f5c04d4415f3b620fb196fa567ce7575d522
(cherry picked from commit 49f62f6ab7fd1b833e9b5bfbcaafa4b45b592d34)
(cherry picked from commit 9cc6d4138946034516fdf579ac084cb954ea6b06)

---

Change-Id: I4eafc5f057df8a3c15560ace255d05602db56ef6
Closes-Bug: 1843816

commit_message:
Fix stable gate

This is a combination of 2 commits.

---

py2/3: Stop using stdlib's putrequest(); it only does ASCII

Note that this only affects the functest client.

See also: https://bugs.python.org/issue36274 and
https://bugs.python.org/issue38216

This was previously done just for py3 compatibility, but following
https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/bb8071a our stable gates are
all broken -- apparently, they're running a 2.7 pre-release?

(cherry picked from commit c0ae48ba9aafb0b91869ea3bae8da07a32088777)
(cherry picked from commit 2b4d58952cae8b174fb60529d5284c1d328e9287)

---

bufferedhttp: ensure query params are properly quoted

Recent versions of py27 [1] have begun raising InvalidURL if you try to
include non-ASCII characters in the request path. This was observed
recently in the periodic checks of stable/ocata and stable/pike. In
particular, we would spin up some in-process servers in
test.unit.proxy.test_server.TestSocketObjectVersions and do a container
listing with a prefix param that included raw (unquoted) UTF-8. This
query string would pass unmolested through the proxy, tripping the
InvalidURL error when bufferedhttp called putrequest.

More recent versions of Swift would not exhibit this particular failure,
as the listing_formats middleware would force a decoding/re-encoding of
the query string for account and container requests. However, object
requests with errant query strings would likely be able to trip the same
error.

Swift on py3 should not exhibit this behavior, as we so
thoroughly re-write the request line to avoid hitting
https://bugs.python.org/issue33973.

Now, always parse and re-encode the query string in bufferedhttp. This
prevents any errors on object requests and cleans up any callers that
might use bufferedhttp directly.

[1] Anything after https://github.com/python/cpython/commit/bb8071a;
    see https://bugs.python.org/issue30458

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/684769
Closes-Bug: 1843816
Related-Change: Id3ce37aa0402e2d8dd5784ce329d7cb4fbaf700d
Related-Change: Ie648f5c04d4415f3b620fb196fa567ce7575d522
(cherry picked from commit 49f62f6ab7fd1b833e9b5bfbcaafa4b45b592d34)
(cherry picked from commit 9cc6d4138946034516fdf579ac084cb954ea6b06)

---

Change-Id: I4eafc5f057df8a3c15560ace255d05602db56ef6

commit_message:
Remove leftovers after NeutronExternalNetworkBridge option

This option was removed some time ago in [1] but there were some
leftovers which we missed to clean.
This patch cleans them from heat templates.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/604764/

Change-Id: Iafcc6f00f28731bcf971de571321dfac808f7ce8

commit_message:
There is no Java 8 in Debian 'buster' (part 3)

Good to have proper Java version. Better is when JAVA_HOME is also
adjusted to point to proper directory. And to have it set proper way.

Change-Id: I0f83c3498028135751b0b887665d009e5e19410f

commit_message:
Implement DVR-aware fixed IP lookups

This change adds DVR-aware announcements for routable fixed IP's
to be sent, thereby routing traffic directly to the appropriate
compute node instead of the centralized router on the network node.

Change-Id: I3aecdd7979dba97dab12a6550655c90a57f56cb3
Partial-Bug: #1775250

commit_message:
Support Ignition for userdata

Fedora CoreOS will replace Fedora Atomic being the next generation
container OS. So it would be nice to support Fedora CoreOS in Heat.
In Fedora CoreOS, the cloud-init will be replaced with Ignition[1],
so the changes proposed in this patch are mainly focusing on how to
support Ignition when using Heat SOFTWARE_CONFIG with Ignition.

Task: 36671
Story: 2006566

Change-Id: I11df2431634de7d8b584b1a2ac733d43959e34fc
(cherry picked from commit f6249c0110cf2ce8d1b2b7116f872c2df29e5666)

[{'created': '2019-07-26 03:13:49.000000000', 'message': "Modify the help message of `-c`/`--column` parameter

Some users ues `-c`/`--column` parameter in the wrong way, such as:
--column='ID Name'
--column='ID:Name'
--column='ID,Name'
The patch modifies the help message of `-c`/`--column` parameter
to indicate the correct use of the parameter.

Change-Id: I7a5082ea6cbb91e2c5d3348f5a52558aab09d820

Story: 2004845
"}]
commit_message:
Modify the help message of `-c`/`--column` parameter

Some users ues `-c`/`--column` parameter in the wrong way, such as:
--column='ID Name'
--column='ID:Name'
--column='ID,Name'
The patch modifies the help message of `-c`/`--column` parameter
to indicate the correct use of the parameter.

Change-Id: I7a5082ea6cbb91e2c5d3348f5a52558aab09d820
Task: 29052
Story: 2004845

subject: Stop silently ignoring invalid 'nova boot --hint' options
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-10-01 14:36:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-01 14:42:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I would like to see a short release note for the change in behavior on master and then that can be squashed into the backports as well. This is proper hardening but it changes something that used to silently pass (incorrectly) to outright fail and for that we should probably have a release note in case it catches anyone off guard.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-10-01 14:47:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I would like to see a short release note for the change in behavior
 > on master and then that can be squashed into the backports as well.
 > This is proper hardening but it changes something that used to
 > silently pass (incorrectly) to outright fail and for that we should
 > probably have a release note in case it catches anyone off guard.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-01 14:36:11.000000000', 'message': 'Stop silently ignoring invalid 'nova boot --hint' options

The '--hint' option for 'nova boot' expects a key-value pair like so:

  nova boot --hint group=245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896 ...

However, the command doesn't complain if this isn't the case, meaning
typos like the below aren't indicated to the user:

  nova boot --hint 245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896

Due to how we'd implemented this here, this ultimately results in us
POSTing the following as part of the body to 'os-servers':

  {
    ...
    "OS-SCH-HNT:scheduler_hints": {
      "245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896": null
    }
    ...
  }

Which is unfortunately allowed and ignored by nova due to the use of
'additionalProperties' in the schema [1]

Do what we do for loads of other options and explicitly fail on invalid
values.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/19.0.0/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/servers.py#L142-L146

Change-Id: I0f9f75cba68e7582d32d4aab2f8f077b4360d386

commit_message:
Stop silently ignoring invalid 'nova boot --hint' options

The '--hint' option for 'nova boot' expects a key-value pair like so:

  nova boot --hint group=245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896 ...

However, the command doesn't complain if this isn't the case, meaning
typos like the below aren't indicated to the user:

  nova boot --hint 245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896

Due to how we'd implemented this here, this ultimately results in us
POSTing the following as part of the body to 'os-servers':

  {
    ...
    "OS-SCH-HNT:scheduler_hints": {
      "245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896": null
    }
    ...
  }

Which is unfortunately allowed and ignored by nova due to the use of
'additionalProperties' in the schema [1]

Do what we do for loads of other options and explicitly fail on invalid
values.

NOTE(stephenfin): This includes the release note first added separately
in change I753e9a0cda1e118578373c519cf2fb2dd605a623.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/19.0.0/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/servers.py#L142-L146

Change-Id: I0f9f75cba68e7582d32d4aab2f8f077b4360d386
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1845322
(cherry picked from commit 6954aacd54e85859fecde22ac04db1ce7601dd35)

commit_message:
Add alternative tenks deploy and teardown entrypoints.

Allows users to explicitly specify which type of tenks
deployment they wish to create / destroy.
Preserves existing behaviour with defaults.
Modifies Zuul tests to use new tenks-deploy entrypoints.

Change-Id: I9aafed8481fd7564c0fc0abe5f6b21eceb824d75
(cherry picked from commit 0d598bf01ddc990429c698fc88c8c41c390e5bac)

commit_message:
Add AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation filter tests

This change adds four new testcases that verify whether the
tenancy based isolation works correctly.

Change-Id: I95556d792f77530022ef4150727631ff8c521541

commit_message:
Bye, bye readthedocs-failing

We introduced the readthedocs-failing template over a year ago so
that repos get updated (see [1]).
This experiment succeeded for some repos, for others it failed.

Telling teams for over a year about this problem is IMHO enough, so
let's stop this.

This change replaces the readthedocs-failing template with a template
that just builds the docs but does not publish so that we can remove the
readthedocs-failing template.

For yaql repository, it remove the job, instead change
https://review.opendev.org/685619 is proposed to import the template.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-August/132836.html

Change-Id: I722d8848b1a1877d758e30c14537f553b93da168

commit_message:
Remove windmill docs jobs

Remove the failing-rtd jobs, a template for just building docs was
proposed everywhere. Paul - as windmill maintainer - will import or
rework.

Change-Id: I83453ced456a1c87e4a88d92a9fa700d1d2e33b3

commit_message:
WIP Add collection link to the versioned version doc

In the API-WG proposal "Add guidelines on Version Discovery" it is
suggested to add a collection link to the links list in the
single-version version discovery document so that a consumer knows how
to find the unversioned version discovery document without URL
manipulation. (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/459710/)

This is a patch implementing that suggestion - mostly so we can point to
something as a "look, it's not super hard"

Change-Id: Ib5d0d982bf5b9d4db55be3f6ad6f071c0817daec

commit_message:
Remove the Libvirt Scality volume driver

That driver is a bit outdated. Let's remove it for now to alleviate
maintenance burden.

Change-Id: Ie89eff85086f5602bb90789a84cbbce685a7f6b6

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-28 16:34:03.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: change images cache and backend lock path

This is necessary to comply with cases when 'image_cache_subdirectory_name'
is set to something unique for each compute node. In such cases locking
directory should also be different.

Change-Id: I65b39808ffc0772f1c2e86002e7d2b1a7af78bc4
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: change images cache and backend lock path

This is necessary to comply with cases when 'image_cache_subdirectory_name'
is set to something unique for each compute node. In such cases locking
directory should also be different.

Change-Id: I65b39808ffc0772f1c2e86002e7d2b1a7af78bc4

commit_message:
libvirt: enable console log for virtuozzo

This change enables creation of serial console log for Virtuozzo,
which is done by default since now. Enable serial console config
parameter is ignored as it was before.

Change-Id: I703efaa08ff4c1615756fa7f3980c2886e671274

messages:
[{'account_id': 27487, 'date': '2017-12-21 02:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-12-21 02:54:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2017-12-21 03:37:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-11245 : SUCCESS in 42m 04s'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2017-12-21 03:42:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

First of all, I think you should register a bug or at least write in commit message about what your issue is.'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2017-12-21 03:44:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

And according to your code change, this will lead to API behavior change, so a microversion bump is required, and also a spec to discuss about whether we should remove this limitation or not'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2017-12-22 00:34:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/529458/1/ : FAILURE in 6h 54m 50s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-04 00:45:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

See the prior attempt at this:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164494/

Procedural -2 since this requires the spec to be approved first, and will require a microversion update for the new functionality in the API.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-10-02 16:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
OVS flows for custom ethertypes must be on EGRESS

Some traffic does not work if the OVS flows to permit custom ethertypes
are not set on the base egress table.  If the rule is added to the base
egress table then both ingress and egress work properly.  Also move
initialization code to the function to initialize egress.

Related-Bug: #1832758
Change-Id: Ia312fe75df58723bf41804eec4bd918d223bd60c

xenserver: recheck'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2016-11-02 01:32:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2016-11-03 15:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

So I think what we need to do here is not restrict what names people can use, but instead allow people to search for an instance with an invalid regex.

I mean, if you have "invalid<regex)name" as your name, we simply do an exact match in the database, rather than doing a regex based name search. i.e. for every invalid regex, we disable the regex parse and try an exact match instead.

Note: users will always be OK showing the server by requesting it using the uuid.

If we wanted to stop people creating servers with names that are an invalid regex, we would need to do that in a new microversion, as it will break existing users. As such, that fix would not help the users trying to search for existing instances.'}, {'account_id': 18337, 'date': '2016-11-04 16:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18337, 'date': '2016-11-04 16:10:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-04 17:24:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

This patch doesn't work anymore because of this query param validation introduced in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408571/ and schema definition in: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/servers.py#L281.

We can allow users to search with invalid regex by changing the schema definition in L281.  I'm not sure if that is the right way to do. Please suggest."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-02-10 13:44:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Good question, I think you can relax the checking (allow any string), as part of this patch.

Will need to talk to the API subteam about this. Their timezone overlap isn't great with either of us though. alex_xu is good to talk to about these things. Not 100% sure what time he comes online though."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-02-10 13:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

-1 if for the fix up around relaxing the params.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2017-03-05 16:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

@Sujitha, I think in the beginning the contract of API is that "name" parameter only accept a valid regex. So I don't think we should change our API to accept invalid regex without Microversion.

But we can still have way to search instance with name as an invalid regex.

For example, an instance with name "+[abc]", it is invalid regex.

So the user should query the instance like this "/servers?name=\+\[abc\]".

So I think we should update the api-ref to tell the user how can query a instance with a invalid regex.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-03-06 09:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

@Alex, that was a really recent change to restrict the name, AFAIK. See the bug folks were reporting on v2.1 until recently.

I could be wrong though. Its tempting to backport this fix, over the top of the restriction.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-03-06 10:13:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-2

OK, we have have sinced merged this one: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/344945/

I originally though we should take this patch after the above one.

But on reflection, there is a problem here. While the UX is strange, name really is a regex, and if we default to exact match for each regex we get, there is no way to debug when you get your regex wrong, when you really did want a regex and not an exact match.

Now ideally we would have both name= (exact match) and name_regex= maybe we should add a microversion to make a change a bit like that, so its clearer what is going on?'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 03:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-10-02 16:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Allow finding instance with invalid regex name

Currently, when invalid regex pattern is given as name, nova
allows creating the instance. But when the instance name is used in
nova show (/start/stop), 400 error with message "The regex for
server name is incorrect" is thrown. This is not a correct behavior.

This patch allows finding a server with an invalid regex pattern name.
When the name is an invalid regex, we simply do an exact db match rather
than doing a regex based name search.

Change-Id: Ia6dfe34c2672522e7951ffaa8145aeef49bd41c0
Closes-bug: #1523668

commit_message:
decode_as_bytes can not be used when oslo.serialization < 2.15.0

# TODO(gcb): Just use base64utils.decode_as_bytes(user_data)
# when https://review.openstack.org/#/c/410797/ is merged and
# ensure oslo.serialization >=2.15.0 in Nova requirements.txt.

Change-Id: Ib3fdb0e63f06ef07c19b42a92933b65227c72e7a

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-14 09:14:50.000000000', 'message': "Update hypervisor host when multi-n-cpu with ironic driver do rebalancing

In an environment with multiple nova-computes running Ironic driver
with hashring, when one of the compute nodes is down all instances
bound to this nova-compute are not manageable. This patch cut off
the previous relationship between the broken nova-compute and it's
managed instance and rebuild the new relationship between a selected
nova-compute and the instance.
The benefit of this patch is the instance still manageable(start,
stop, get-serial-console).
When the nova-compute which control the instance is down, the instance
is still manageable(after the another nova-compute takeovers)
Then the broken nova-compute is recovery. it will regain the control to
the instance.
If we add a new nova-compute with ironic driver, It causes rebalancing.
the relationship between nova-compute and instance will change permanently.
I think it is acceptable. Because instance.host for nova-compute with
ironic driver just means which nova-compute handle the user's request.

Change-Id: I0923469c653be2f20131799dbd223724f8d39ffc
closes-Bug: #1670239

commit_message:
Update hypervisor host when multi-n-cpu(ironic driver) do rebalancing

In an environment with multiple nova-computes running Ironic driver
with hashring, when one of the compute nodes is down all instances
bound to this nova-compute are not manageable. This patch cut off
the previous relationship between the broken nova-compute and it's
managed instance and rebuild the new relationship between a selected
nova-compute and the instance.
The benefit of this patch is the instance still manageable(start,
stop, get-serial-console).
When the nova-compute which control the instance is down, the instance
is still manageable(after the another nova-compute takeovers)
Then the broken nova-compute is recovery. it will regain the control to
the instance.
If we add a new nova-compute with ironic driver, It causes rebalancing.
the relationship between nova-compute and instance will change
permanently.
I think it is acceptable. Because instance.host for nova-compute with
ironic driver just means which nova-compute handle the user's request.

Change-Id: I0923469c653be2f20131799dbd223724f8d39ffc
closes-Bug: #1670239

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-27 20:53:31.000000000', 'message': 'Remove @safe_connect from _get_sharing_providers

...thus making it raise a ksa ClientException instead of returning None
if something goes wrong communicating with the placement API.

This method's only consumer, _refresh_associations, would have
previously raised a TypeError attempting to iterate over None. It will
now instead raise the ClientException through. Other code paths in
_refresh_associations were already able to raise ClientException, so the
only behavior change is that the (previously undocumented) TypeError is
no longer possible.

This will be significant addressing the related bug to circumscribe the
exceptions we can "expect" from _refresh_associations.

Change-Id: I1a54c7902ab842c5dad804c8e1819ac7e84085ca
Related-Bug: #1841481
'}]
commit_message:
Remove @safe_connect from _get_sharing_providers

...thus making it raise a ksa ClientException instead of returning None
if something goes wrong communicating with the placement API.

This method's only consumer, _refresh_associations, would have
previously raised a TypeError attempting to iterate over None. It will
now instead raise the ClientException through. Other code paths in
_refresh_associations were already able to raise ClientException, so the
only behavior change is that the (previously undocumented) TypeError is
no longer possible.

This will be significant addressing the related bug to circumscribe the
exceptions we can "expect" from _refresh_associations.

Change-Id: I1a54c7902ab842c5dad804c8e1819ac7e84085ca
Related-Bug: #1841481

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-27 20:53:31.000000000', 'message': 'Remove @safe_connect from _get_provider_aggregates

Previously, SchedulerReportClient._get_provider_aggregates was decorated
with @safe_connect, meaning it would return None on various Placement
connect failures. The three consumers of that method were reacting as
follows:

- _refresh_associations was pointedly ignoring the condition, allowing
  subsequent use of the (None) return value to raise an exception.
- aggregate_add_host and aggregate_remove_host were raising
  PlacementAPIConnectFailure.

With this commit, @safe_connect is removed from
_get_provider_aggregates, and the consumers are adjusted as follows:

- _refresh_associations will now simply raise up whatever ksa
  ClientException is triggered. The method was already able to raise
  such exceptions from other code paths, so the only difference from a
  caller's perspective would be that the (previously undocumented)
  TypeError is no longer possible. This will be significant when fixing
  the related bug to make the set of exceptions we "expect" from
  _refresh_associations sane.
- aggregate_add_host and aggregate_remove_host trap and log the
  ClientException and still raise PlacementAPIConnectFailure - i.e. no
  behavior change (other than the additional log).

Change-Id: Id883080b75c9e481c1a3d0c406e2e747fa4031aa
Related-Bug: #1841481
'}]
commit_message:
Remove @safe_connect from _get_provider_aggregates

Previously, SchedulerReportClient._get_provider_aggregates was decorated
with @safe_connect, meaning it would return None on various Placement
connect failures. The three consumers of that method were reacting as
follows:

- _refresh_associations was pointedly ignoring the condition, allowing
  subsequent use of the (None) return value to raise an exception.
- aggregate_add_host and aggregate_remove_host were raising
  PlacementAPIConnectFailure.

With this commit, @safe_connect is removed from
_get_provider_aggregates, and the consumers are adjusted as follows:

- _refresh_associations will now simply raise up whatever ksa
  ClientException is triggered. The method was already able to raise
  such exceptions from other code paths, so the only difference from a
  caller's perspective would be that the (previously undocumented)
  TypeError is no longer possible. This will be significant when fixing
  the related bug to make the set of exceptions we "expect" from
  _refresh_associations sane.
- aggregate_add_host and aggregate_remove_host trap and log the
  ClientException and still raise PlacementAPIConnectFailure - i.e. no
  behavior change (other than the additional log).

Change-Id: Id883080b75c9e481c1a3d0c406e2e747fa4031aa
Related-Bug: #1841481

commit_message:
nova-libvirt: set 'cpuset_cpus' to 'all'

nova-compute-libvirt should be able to run on any CPU, as it launch VMs on
isolated CPUs (they are isolated to be dedicated to run vCPU).

This patch makes sure the right container configurations is applied with
Paunch.

Change-Id: I9b8893e4812a7a3f71bd75f66004ed8d6f67b3d1
(cherry picked from commit 1cbc1ee387cbea6a9f817e766d4fcfb157071e5f)

commit_message:
Constrain molecule

This change constraints molecule so we're not pulling in broken or
otherwise incompatible code. Recent changes to upstream molecule have
introduced some instability. To ensure we're always testing with an
expected release of new upper constraint has been added.

Change-Id: Ia8f200574ed3553986dbacd87d252e5c493259df
Co-Authored-By: tripleo-ansible team
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit e124158433b23eef5efd253cd6839779247c9f46)

commit_message:
Fix fluentd image

fluentd - pin faraday to <0.16

Rocky and earlier only.

Faraday 0.16.x depends on Ruby 2.3+, but td-agent on Ubuntu uses its own
old version of Ruby.

This change pins faraday in the Ubuntu and Debian fluentd images to
versions earlier than 0.16.

Change-Id: Id9a76f459aff016fbc920370c0a3ec58e0397fcb
Closes-Bug: #1845705
(cherry picked from commit a0712ceef3d6c20cdd79417dcff10525c527fb3d)

[{'created': '2019-09-30 21:56:08.000000000', 'message': "Enable saving of rpms

We currently map in the cache dir, but it only saves the metadata. The
improvements would come with the rpm saving as well. In order to have
that, we need to set keepcache=1 which is disabled by default. We can
enable this on the command line via --setopt so we don't have to touch
the container yum configuration.

Change-Id: Ia274dbbad9a220e52b2cfa554dede3bf40055f98
"}]
commit_message:
Enable saving of rpms

We currently map in the cache dir, but it only saves the metadata. The
improvements would come with the rpm saving as well. In order to have
that, we need to set keepcache=1 which is disabled by default. We can
enable this on the command line via --setopt so we don't have to touch
the container yum configuration.

Change-Id: Ia274dbbad9a220e52b2cfa554dede3bf40055f98

commit_message:
Switching default centos url for image promotion

OVB job is failing to connect to cloud.centos.org to download the
centos image. There's a copy of the same image in
images.rdoproject.org which is local to OVB jobs, which should be
even faster to download.

Related-Bug: 1845918
Change-Id: I69fc71c82a34c144b84607b6b85212338d2a4825

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-02 08:04:04.000000000', 'message': "Properly mock cpu_affinity on all unit tests

Two unit tests (test_cont_run_args_validation_true and
test_cont_run_args_validation_false) relied on the machine running
the tests having 8 CPUs. This is not always the case, so let's mock
it, just like we do on tests expecting 4 CPUs.

Change-Id: I98d930d9c7a1a2d54863749d08b97fc9e8867a0e
"}]
commit_message:
Properly mock cpu_affinity on all unit tests

Two unit tests (test_cont_run_args_validation_true and
test_cont_run_args_validation_false) relied on the machine running
the tests having 8 CPUs. This is not always the case, so let's mock
it, just like we do on tests expecting 4 CPUs.

Change-Id: I98d930d9c7a1a2d54863749d08b97fc9e8867a0e

commit_message:
Use charm-internal _upgrade_keyring

This change includes a charms.ceph sync.

The _upgrade_keyring function was removed from charms.ceph
so this charm needs to use the already-existing, charm-
internal version.

Change-Id: Ia7cf352a2456dc85aca6f61d2e88327cd0c15f7e
Closes-Bug: #1845975

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints tox target

We seem to be running into a coverage issue [1] in 4.0.  This patch
raises the lower bound of coverage to 4.1 to get the lower-constraints
target to pass again.

[1] https://github.com/nedbat/coveragepy/issues/359

Change-Id: Ieddef753b4ee3e9b6d246168ed17c5c99e084564

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-20 16:20:36.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If68f6e31fb95b24d9d5257944956f73e69757e55
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If68f6e31fb95b24d9d5257944956f73e69757e55

commit_message:
Fix container image build with multiple regexes

We don't need to provide additional quotes for passing these arguments
to playbooks, since this is now done automatically via
kayobe.utils.quote_and_escape.

Change-Id: I9588b58449e8c8f8eab85ce01b4e130adc150ac6
Story: 2006475
Task: 36416

subject: WIP: Add support for environment variables
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-19 14:34:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-19 14:38:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

mtreinish: I've started drafting this mostly for use in stestr (though I'm sure it can be used elsewhere). Instead of writing:

  [testenv]
  commands =
    stestr run {posargs}

  [testenv:functional]
  commands =
    stestr --test-path=./placement/tests/functional run {posargs}

I'd like to be able to do

  [testenv:functional]
  setenv =
    TEST_PATH=./placement/tests/functional

Which makes more sense in my head and fits in quite nicely with what pytest lets you do. Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-19 14:38:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

WIP because I need to handle nargs!=1, add docs and add tests'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-05-09 11:09:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-10-02 15:20:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
WIP: Add support for environment variables

It can be helpful to use environment variables as default for some
argument. click supports this. It's time cliff did too.

Change-Id: I0850235825fc15d0bd8c64fff7b4856e34f5b3e1
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

subject: New validation: detect failed containers
messages: [{'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-10-02 07:43:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17888, 'date': '2019-10-02 09:48:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-02 07:43:17.000000000', 'message': "New validation: detect failed containers

Failed containers are pretty bad, since we have a degraded service.

Running this validation before an upgrade is a good thing, and
running it after a deploy/upgrade will ensure we're in a right state

Co-Authored-by: Gaël Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I242f1c7cff76e8304696ea10b32c1545fa5b8ea5
(cherry picked from commit bd8cdf41a5d60c49265522302545e19974b15de2)
"}]
commit_message:
New validation: detect failed containers

Failed containers are pretty bad, since we have a degraded service.

Running this validation before an upgrade is a good thing, and
running it after a deploy/upgrade will ensure we're in a right state

Co-Authored-by: Gaël Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I242f1c7cff76e8304696ea10b32c1545fa5b8ea5
(cherry picked from commit bd8cdf41a5d60c49265522302545e19974b15de2)

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia8316bce01d55657507c9ba633add2e83f0fc055

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-01 22:16:57.000000000', 'message': "Reduce scope of 'path' query parameter to noVNC consoles

This is a partial revert of commit
9606c80402f6db20d62b689c58aa8f024183628a which added the 'path' query
parameter to work with noVNC v1.1.0. This broke all other console types
using websockify server (serial, spice) because the websockify server
itself doesn't know how to handle the 'path' query parameter. It is the
noVNC vnc_lite.html file which parses the 'path' variable and uses it
as the url to the websockify server. So, all other console types should
*not* be generating a console access url with a 'path' query parameter,
only noVNC.

Closes-Bug: #1845243

TODO(melwitt): Figure out how to test serial and/or spice console in
the gate

Change-Id: I9521f21a685edc44121d75bdf534c201fa87c2d7
(cherry picked from commit 54125a75fb056dbea115408610f90e7d6eee5139)
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce scope of 'path' query parameter to noVNC consoles

This is a partial revert of commit
9606c80402f6db20d62b689c58aa8f024183628a which added the 'path' query
parameter to work with noVNC v1.1.0. This broke all other console types
using websockify server (serial, spice) because the websockify server
itself doesn't know how to handle the 'path' query parameter. It is the
noVNC vnc_lite.html file which parses the 'path' variable and uses it
as the url to the websockify server. So, all other console types should
*not* be generating a console access url with a 'path' query parameter,
only noVNC.

Closes-Bug: #1845243

TODO(melwitt): Figure out how to test serial and/or spice console in
the gate

Change-Id: I9521f21a685edc44121d75bdf534c201fa87c2d7
(cherry picked from commit 54125a75fb056dbea115408610f90e7d6eee5139)

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints tox target

We seem to be running into a coverage issue [1] in 4.0.  This patch
raises the lower bound of coverage to 4.1 to get the lower-constraints
target to pass again.

Update sphinx requirements to match global-requirements.

[1] https://github.com/nedbat/coveragepy/issues/359

Change-Id: Ieddef753b4ee3e9b6d246168ed17c5c99e084564
(cherry picked from commit 79f387fbd5fde9e671dd32684f73dbf3451379dc)

commit_message:
Remove Sheepdog tests from zuul config

This was not working in Stein either. Backporting to allow us to
eventually remove the job definition in openstack-zuul-jobs.

Change-Id: I4ca37dc248ac5defbc988507379288299b19a6d7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Improve log of k8s health status check

When the k8s cluster is created in a private network without
FIP and without a LB FIP, the cluster is not reachable by Magnum
control plane. For this case, the cluster health status is unknown
for Magnum and Magnum should not connect the cluster to avoid
unnecessary logs.

Task: 36187
Story: 2006383

Change-Id: Ibb589ec51f91f05a334c907560ef5fe57cbfbffb

[{'created': '2019-09-25 15:30:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add a configurable delay to Nova Evacuate calls

Add a configurable delay to Nova Evacuate calls

In case /var/lib/nova/instances resides on NFS we have seen migrations
failing with 'Failed to get "write" lock - Is another process using the
image' errors.

This has been tracked down to grace/lease timeouts not having expired
before attempting the migration/evacuate, so in this cases it might be
desirable to delay the nova evacuate call to give the storage time to
release the locks.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/684777/

Change-Id: I5ec6a5b0c66579e068e811f49aae10a5f406158a
Resolves: rhbz#1740069

commit_message:
Add a configurable delay to Nova Evacuate calls

Add a configurable delay to Nova Evacuate calls

In case /var/lib/nova/instances resides on NFS we have seen migrations
failing with 'Failed to get "write" lock - Is another process using the
image' errors.

This has been tracked down to grace/lease timeouts not having expired
before attempting the migration/evacuate, so in this cases it might be
desirable to delay the nova evacuate call to give the storage time to
release the locks.

Related resource-agents change: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/684777/

Change-Id: I5ec6a5b0c66579e068e811f49aae10a5f406158a
Resolves: rhbz#1740069
